DataElement.preferredName: Limited Activity Due To Impairment Or Health Problem Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the impairment or health condition that limits the activity of a person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Limit Activity Due To Impairment Or Health Problem
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Anything that limits; a limitation._The state of being active; any specific activity._Expected or scheduled._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease._Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Anything that limits; a limitation.:The state of being active; any specific activity.

Concepts.definition: Anything that limits; a limitation.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredName: Due To Impairment Or Health Problem
Property.preferredDefinition: Expected or scheduled.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: Expected or scheduled.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease._A state of being, such as a state of health._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.: Apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Excessively affected by emotion.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.
Apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Excessively affected by emotion.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

Concepts.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pathological increase in blood pressure; a repeatedly elevated blood pressure exceeding 140 over 90 mmHg.

Concepts.definition: Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurologic function secondary to hemorrhagic or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event. Infarction or hemorrhage may be demonstrated either directly by imaging,laboratory, or pathologic examination in patients with symptom duration less than 24 hours, or inferred by symptoms lasting greater than or equal to 24 hours (or fatal within 24 hours) that cannot be attributed to another cause.  Diagnostic tests include CT scan, MRI, angiography, and EEG to locate and evaluate the extent of the hemorrhagic or ischemic damage in the brain parenchyma, coagulation studies, complete blood count, comprehensive metabolic panel, and urinalysis.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision. (On-line Medical Dictionary): An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Sight; the faculty of vision, the perception of objects by the eye.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The faculty of vision, the perception of objects by the eye.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI): Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of traveling by foot. : Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: The act of traveling by foot.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken. - 2003: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The point of connection between two bones or elements of a skeleton, especially if the articulation allows motion.: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Concepts.definition: A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.
The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The dorsal area between the base of the neck and the sacrum. : An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: The dorsal area between the base of the neck and the sacrum.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inflammatory process affecting a joint. Causes include infection, autoimmune processes, degenerative processes, and trauma. Signs and symptoms may include swelling around the affected joint and pain.

Concepts.definition: An inflammatory process affecting a joint. Causes include infection, autoimmune processes, degenerative processes, and trauma. Signs and symptoms may include swelling around the affected joint and pain.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A state of being, such as a state of health.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
